A Landform is a physical, natural or manmade structure which is situated on earth's surface, whereas a Landscape is the combined natural and cultural features of an area on the earth's surface. The relationship between the two is that a landscape comprises of landforms.
A landform is a natural feature of the Earth's surface. Landforms together make up a given terrain, and their arrangement on the landscape or the study of same is known as topography.

There are two types of landform in desert environments:  those where wind is the main agent of erosion. Coastal landscapes: An environment in which water is the main geomorphic agent. Water, in the. form of waves, can either gently lap or violently crash against the coastline. Making the world better, one answer at a time. Landform is the any recognizable naturally formed surface feature of the earth. Landforms have a characteristic shape and can include such large features as plains, plateaus,mountains,valleys as well as small features such as hills, canyons and eskers.

Landform elements also include seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins. A land form is an area that has been created through the progression of nature. For example, a mesa, mountains, glaciers, wetlands, islands, etc, etc... A landmark is an area, or a man made structure of historical importance.

Ans: Landform is the any recognizable naturally formed surface feature of the earth. Landforms have a characteristic shape and can include such large features as plains, plateaus, mountains, valleys as well as small features such as hills, canyons and eskers.

Best Answer: Dear MamianG, A landform or physical feature in the earth sciences and geology sub-fields, comprises a geomorphological unit, and is largely defined by its surface form and location in the landscape, as part of the terrain, and as such, is typically an element of topography. A land form is an area that has been created through the progression of nature. For example, a mesa, mountains, glaciers, wetlands, islands, etc, etc... A landmark is an area, or a man made structure of historical importance.
